concepts.definition: A block that generates naturally in the Overworld, often found underground. It is the most basic and common resource for crafting tools, weapons, and armor.

variations.text: Mining stone with a wooden pickaxe yields cobblestone.

concepts.definition: A useful mineral that generates deep underground. Iron can be smelted into iron ingots, which are used to craft stronger tools, armor, and many other items.

variations.text: Smelt iron ore in a furnace to get iron ingots.

concepts.definition: A rare and valuable mineral found deep underground. Diamonds are used to craft the strongest tools, weapons, and armor in the game.

variations.text: You need an iron pickaxe or better to mine diamond ore.

concepts.definition: A hostile mob that spawns in darkness. Zombies attack players on sight and can break down wooden doors.

variations.text: Zombies burn in daylight unless they are wearing a helmet.

concepts.definition: A flying, skeletal mob that shoots arrows. Skeletons are a common threat in caves and at night.

variations.text: Skeletons are weak to melee attacks and can be defeated with a shield.

concepts.definition: A block that can be placed to create structures or light up areas. Torches are crafted using coal or charcoal and sticks.

variations.text: Place torches to prevent hostile mobs from spawning in your base.

concepts.definition: A block that grows crops like wheat, carrots, and potatoes. Farmland must be hydrated by nearby water to grow crops.

variations.text: Use a hoe to till grass or dirt blocks into farmland.

description: A beginner's guide to essential blocks, resources, and mobs in Minecraft.
title: Minecraft Basics
